title: Bug 113047 - No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there is no listing of children nodes.
EB: The data set editor page should display a listing of children nodes when the data source is changed.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement.
2. Open the data set editor and navigate to the 'Data Source' page.
3. Change the data source to a new one.

Expected result:
After changing the data source, the data set editor page should display a listing of the new data source's database, table, and column information. Close the data set editor and reopen it to verify the changes.
